name: ZTS
comment: Copyright The Athenz Authors Licensed under the terms of the Apache version 2.0 license. See LICENSE file for terms. The Authorization Management Service (ZTS) API

StringTypeDef.name: SimpleName
StringTypeDef.comment: Copyright The Athenz Authors Licensed under the terms of the Apache version 2.0 license. See LICENSE file for terms. Common name types used by several API definitions A simple identifier, an element of compound name.

StringTypeDef.name: CompoundName
StringTypeDef.comment: A compound name. Most names in this API are compound names.

StringTypeDef.name: DomainName
StringTypeDef.comment: A domain name is the general qualifier prefix, as its uniqueness is managed.

StringTypeDef.name: EntityName
StringTypeDef.comment: An entity name is a short form of a resource name, including only the domain and entity.

StringTypeDef.name: ServiceName
StringTypeDef.comment: A service name will generally be a unique subdomain.

StringTypeDef.name: ResourceName
StringTypeDef.comment: A resource name Note that the EntityName part is optional, that is, a domain name followed by a colon is valid resource name.

StringTypeDef.name: YEncoded
StringTypeDef.comment: YEncoded includes ybase64 chars, as well as = and %. This can represent a user cookie and URL-encoded values.

StringTypeDef.name: AuthorityName
StringTypeDef.comment: Used as the prefix in a signed assertion. This uniquely identifies a signing authority.

StringTypeDef.name: SignedToken
StringTypeDef.comment: A signed assertion if identity. i.e. the user cookie value. This token will only make sense to the authority that generated it, so it is beneficial to have something in the value that is cheaply recognized to quickly reject if it belongs to another authority. In addition to the YEncoded set our token includes ; to separate components and , to separate roles

StructTypeDef.name: ResourceAccess
StructTypeDef.comment: ResourceAccess can be checked and returned as this resource. (same as ZMS.Access)

fields.name: granted
fields.comment: true (allowed) or false (denied)

StructTypeDef.name: PublicKeyEntry
StructTypeDef.comment: The representation of the public key in a service identity object.

fields.name: key
fields.comment: the public key for the service

fields.name: id
fields.comment: the key identifier (version or zone name)

StructTypeDef.name: ServiceIdentity
StructTypeDef.comment: The representation of the service identity object.

fields.name: name
fields.comment: the full name of the service, i.e. "sports.storage"

fields.name: publicKeys
fields.comment: array of public keys for key rotation

fields.name: providerEndpoint
fields.comment: if present, then this service can provision tenants via this endpoint.

fields.name: modified
fields.comment: the timestamp when this entry was last modified

fields.name: executable
fields.comment: the path of the executable that runs the service

fields.name: hosts
fields.comment: list of host names that this service can run on

fields.name: user
fields.comment: local (unix) user name this service can run as

fields.name: group
fields.comment: local (unix) group name this service can run as

StructTypeDef.name: ServiceIdentityList
StructTypeDef.comment: The representation for an enumeration of services in the namespace.

fields.name: names
fields.comment: list of service names

StructTypeDef.name: HostServices
StructTypeDef.comment: The representation for an enumeration of services authorized to run on a specific host.

fields.name: host
fields.comment: name of the host

fields.name: names
fields.comment: list of service names authorized to run on this host

EnumTypeDef.name: AssertionEffect
EnumTypeDef.comment: Every assertion can have the effect of ALLOW or DENY.

StructTypeDef.name: Assertion
StructTypeDef.comment: A representation for the encapsulation of an action to be performed on a resource by a principal.

fields.name: role
fields.comment: the subject of the assertion, a role

fields.name: resource
fields.comment: the object of the assertion. Must be in the local namespace. Can contain wildcards

fields.name: action
fields.comment: the predicate of the assertion. Can contain wildcards

fields.name: effect
fields.comment: the effect of the assertion in the policy language

fields.name: id
fields.comment: assertion id - auto generated by server

StructTypeDef.name: Policy
StructTypeDef.comment: The representation for a Policy with set of assertions.

fields.name: name
fields.comment: name of the policy

fields.name: modified
fields.comment: last modification timestamp of this policy

fields.name: assertions
fields.comment: list of defined assertions for this policy

fields.name: domain
fields.comment: name of the domain

fields.name: policies
fields.comment: list of policies defined in this server

StructTypeDef.name: SignedPolicyData
StructTypeDef.comment: A representation of policies object defined in a given server.

fields.name: policyData
fields.comment: list of policies defined in a domain

fields.name: zmsSignature
fields.comment: zms signature generated based on the domain policies object

fields.name: zmsKeyId
fields.comment: the identifier of the zms key used to generate the signature

fields.name: modified
fields.comment: when the domain itself was last modified

fields.name: expires
fields.comment: timestamp specifying the expiration time for using this set of policies

StructTypeDef.name: DomainSignedPolicyData
StructTypeDef.comment: A signed bulk transfer of policies. The data is signed with server's private key.

fields.name: signedPolicyData
fields.comment: policy data signed by ZMS

fields.name: signature
fields.comment: signature generated based on the domain policies object

fields.name: keyId
fields.comment: the identifier of the key used to generate the signature

StructTypeDef.name: RoleToken
StructTypeDef.comment: A representation of a signed RoleToken

StructTypeDef.name: Access
StructTypeDef.comment: Access can be checked and returned as this resource.

fields.name: granted
fields.comment: true (allowed) or false (denied)

StructTypeDef.name: Identity
StructTypeDef.comment: Identity - a signed assertion of service or human identity, the response could be either a client certificate or just a regular NToken (depending if the request contained a csr or not).

fields.name: name
fields.comment: name of the identity, fully qualified, i.e. my.domain.service1, or aws.1232321321312.myusername

fields.name: certificate
fields.comment: a certificate usable for both client and server in TLS connections

fields.name: caCertBundle
fields.comment: the CA certificate chain to use with all IMS-generated certs

fields.name: sshCertificate
fields.comment: the SSH certificate, signed by the CA (user or host)

fields.name: sshCertificateSigner
fields.comment: the SSH CA's public key for the sshCertificate (user or host)

fields.name: serviceToken
fields.comment: service token instead of TLS certificate

fields.name: attributes
fields.comment: other config-like attributes determined at boot time

StructTypeDef.name: InstanceInformation
StructTypeDef.comment: Instance object that includes requested service details plus host document that is signed by provider as part of the host bootstrap process

fields.name: document
fields.comment: signed document containing attributes like IP address, instance-id, account#, etc.

fields.name: signature
fields.comment: the signature for the document

fields.name: keyId
fields.comment: the keyid used to sign the document

fields.name: domain
fields.comment: the domain of the instance

fields.name: service
fields.comment: the service this instance is supposed to run

fields.name: csr
fields.comment: return a certificate in the response

fields.name: ssh
fields.comment: if present, return an SSH host certificate

fields.name: csr
fields.comment: Cert CSR signed by the service's private key (public key registered in ZMS)

fields.name: expiryTime
fields.comment: in seconds how long token should be valid for

StructTypeDef.name: AWSInstanceInformation
StructTypeDef.comment: AWSInstanceInformation - the information a booting EC2 instance must provide to ZTS to authenticate.

fields.name: document
fields.comment: signed document containing attributes like IP address, instance-id, account#, etc.

fields.name: signature
fields.comment: the signature for the document

fields.name: domain
fields.comment: the domain of the instance

fields.name: service
fields.comment: the service this instance is supposed to run

fields.name: csr
fields.comment: return a certificate in the response

fields.name: ssh
fields.comment: if present, return an SSH host certificate. Format is JSON.

fields.name: name
fields.comment: the full service identity name (same as the EC2 instance profile name)

fields.name: account
fields.comment: the account id (as a string) for the instance. parsed from the instance profile ARN

fields.name: cloud
fields.comment: the name of the cloud (namespace) within the account, parsed from the name

fields.name: subnet
fields.comment: not used

fields.name: access
fields.comment: the AWS Access Key Id for the role

fields.name: secret
fields.comment: the AWS Secret Access Key for the role

fields.name: token
fields.comment: the AWS STS Token for the role

fields.name: expires
fields.comment: the expiration time of the access keys

fields.name: modified
fields.comment: the modified time of the access keys

fields.name: flavor
fields.comment: the 'flavor' of the access keys, i.e. "AWS-HMAC"

fields.name: csr
fields.comment: request an X.509 certificate

fields.name: ssh
fields.comment: request an SSH certificate

StructTypeDef.name: OSTKInstanceInformation
StructTypeDef.comment: Instance object that includes requested service details plus host document that is signed by Openstack as part of the host bootstrap process

fields.name: document
fields.comment: signed document containing attributes like IP address, instance-id, account#, etc.

fields.name: signature
fields.comment: the signature for the document

fields.name: keyId
fields.comment: the keyid used to sign the document

fields.name: domain
fields.comment: the domain of the instance

fields.name: service
fields.comment: the service this instance is supposed to run

fields.name: csr
fields.comment: return a certificate in the response

fields.name: csr
fields.comment: request an X.509 certificate

fields.name: provider
fields.comment: the provider service name (i.e. "aws.us-west-2", "sys.openstack.cluster1")

fields.name: domain
fields.comment: the domain of the instance

fields.name: service
fields.comment: the service this instance is supposed to run

fields.name: attestationData
fields.comment: identity attestation data including document with its signature containing attributes like IP address, instance-id, account#, etc.

fields.name: csr
fields.comment: the Certificate Signing Request for the expected X.509 certificate in the response

fields.name: ssh
fields.comment: if present, return an SSH host certificate. Format is JSON.

fields.name: token
fields.comment: if true, return a service token signed by ZTS for this service

fields.name: csr
fields.comment: the Certificate Signing Request for the expected X.509 certificate in the response

fields.name: ssh
fields.comment: if present, return an SSH host certificate. Format is JSON.

fields.name: token
fields.comment: if true, return a service token signed by ZTS for this service

fields.name: provider
fields.comment: the provider service name (i.e. "aws.us-west-2", "sys.openstack.cluster1")

fields.name: name
fields.comment: name of the identity, fully qualified, i.e. my.domain.service1

fields.name: instanceId
fields.comment: unique instance id within provider's namespace

fields.name: x509Certificate
fields.comment: an X.509 certificate usable for both client and server in TLS connections

fields.name: x509CertificateSigner
fields.comment: the CA certificate chain to verify all generated X.509 certs

fields.name: sshCertificate
fields.comment: the SSH certificate, signed by the CA (user or host)

fields.name: sshCertificateSigner
fields.comment: the SSH CA's public key for the sshCertificate (user or host)

fields.name: serviceToken
fields.comment: service token instead of TLS certificate

fields.name: attributes
fields.comment: other config-like attributes determined at boot time

fields.name: domainName
fields.comment: name of the domain the metrics pertain to

fields.name: metricList
fields.comment: list of the domains metrics

resources.comment: Check access for the specified operation on the specified resource for the currently authenticated user. This is the slow centralized access for control-plane purposes. Use distributed mechanisms for decentralized (data-plane) access by fetching signed policies and role tokens for users. With this endpoint the resource is part of the uri and restricted to its strict definition of resource name. If needed, you can use the GetAccessExt api that allows resource name to be less restrictive.

inputs.name: action
inputs.comment: action as specified in the policy assertion, i.e. update or read

inputs.name: resource
inputs.comment: the resource to check access against, i.e. "media.news:articles"

inputs.name: domain
inputs.comment: usually null. If present, it specifies an alternate domain for cross-domain trust relation

inputs.name: checkPrincipal
inputs.comment: usually null. If present, carry out the access check for this principal

resources.comment: Check access for the specified operation on the specified resource for the currently authenticated user. This is the slow centralized access for control-plane purposes.

inputs.name: action
inputs.comment: action as specified in the policy assertion, i.e. update or read

inputs.name: resource
inputs.comment: the resource to check access against, i.e. "media.news:articles"

inputs.name: domain
inputs.comment: usually null. If present, it specifies an alternate domain for cross-domain trust relation

inputs.name: checkPrincipal
inputs.comment: usually null. If present, carry out the access check for this principal

resources.name: GetResourceAccessExt

resources.comment: Get info for the specified ServiceIdentity.

inputs.name: domainName
inputs.comment: name of the domain

inputs.name: serviceName
inputs.comment: name of the service to be retrieved

resources.comment: Enumerate services provisioned in this domain.

inputs.name: domainName
inputs.comment: name of the domain

resources.comment: Retrieve the specified public key from the service.

inputs.name: domainName
inputs.comment: name of the domain

inputs.name: serviceName
inputs.comment: name of the service

inputs.name: keyId
inputs.comment: the identifier of the public key to be retrieved

resources.comment: Enumerate services provisioned on a specific host

inputs.name: host
inputs.comment: name of the host

resources.comment: Get a signed policy enumeration from the service, to transfer to a local store. An ETag is generated for the PolicyList that changes when any item in the list changes. If the If-None-Match header is provided, and it matches the ETag that would be returned, then a NOT_MODIFIED response is returned instead of the list.

inputs.name: domainName
inputs.comment: name of the domain

inputs.name: matchingTag
inputs.comment: Retrieved from the previous request, this timestamp specifies to the server to return any policies modified since this time

outputs.name: tag
outputs.comment: The current latest modification timestamp is returned in this header

resources.comment: Return a security token for the specific role in the namespace that the principal can assume. If the role is omitted, then all roles in the namespace that the authenticated user can assume are returned. the caller can specify how long the RoleToken should be valid for by specifying the minExpiryTime and maxExpiryTime parameters. The minExpiryTime specifies that the returned RoleToken must be at least valid (min/lower bound) for specified number of seconds, while maxExpiryTime specifies that the RoleToken must be at most valid (max/upper bound) for specified number of seconds. If both values are the same, the server must return a RoleToken for that many seconds. If no values are specified, the server's default RoleToken Timeout value is used.

inputs.name: domainName
inputs.comment: name of the domain

inputs.name: role
inputs.comment: only interested for a token for this role

inputs.name: minExpiryTime
inputs.comment: in seconds min expiry time

inputs.name: maxExpiryTime
inputs.comment: in seconds max expiry time

inputs.name: proxyForPrincipal
inputs.comment: optional this request is proxy for this principal

resources.comment: Return a TLS certificate for the specific role in the namespace that the principal can assume. Role certificates are valid for 30 days by default

inputs.name: domainName
inputs.comment: name of the domain

inputs.name: roleName
inputs.comment: name of role

inputs.name: req
inputs.comment: csr request

inputs.name: domainName
inputs.comment: name of the domain

inputs.name: roleName
inputs.comment: name of the role to check access for

inputs.name: principal
inputs.comment: carry out the access check for this principal

inputs.name: domainName
inputs.comment: name of the domain

inputs.name: principal
inputs.comment: carry out the role access lookup for this principal

resources.comment: Get list of tenant domains user has access to for specified provider domain and service

inputs.name: providerDomainName
inputs.comment: name of the provider domain

inputs.name: userName
inputs.comment: name of the user to retrieve tenant domain access for

inputs.name: roleName
inputs.comment: role name to filter on when looking for the tenants in provider

inputs.name: serviceName
inputs.comment: service name to filter on when looking for the tenants in provider

resources.comment: Refresh Service NToken into TLS Certificate

inputs.name: domain
inputs.comment: name of the domain requesting the refresh

inputs.name: service
inputs.comment: name of the service requesting the refresh

inputs.name: req
inputs.comment: the refresh request

resources.comment: Register an instance in AWS ZTS. Whether this succeeds or not depends on the contents of the request (the request itself is not authenticated or authorized in the normal way). If successful, the Identity is returned as a x.509 client certificate (to be used in TLS operations)
Rotate certs. Make this request with previous cert, the result are new certs for the same identity.

inputs.name: domain
inputs.comment: name of the domain requesting the refresh

inputs.name: service
inputs.comment: name of the service requesting the refresh

inputs.name: req
inputs.comment: the refresh request

resources.comment: perform an AWS AssumeRole of the target role and return the credentials. ZTS must have been granted the ability to assume the role in IAM, and granted the ability to ASSUME_AWS_ROLE in Athenz for this to succeed.

inputs.name: domainName
inputs.comment: name of the domain containing the role, which implies the target account

inputs.name: role
inputs.comment: the target AWS role name in the domain account, in Athenz terms, i.e. "the.role"

resources.comment: Get a cert for service being bootstrapped by Openstack

Refresh self identity if the original identity was issued by ZTS The token must include the original requestor's name and the server will verify that the service still has authorization to grant inception to the current service requesting to refresh its identity

inputs.name: domain
inputs.comment: name of the tenant domain

inputs.name: service
inputs.comment: name of the tenant service

inputs.name: req
inputs.comment: the refresh request

outputs.name: location
outputs.comment: return location for subsequent patch requests

resources.comment: only TLS Certificate authentication is allowed

inputs.name: provider
inputs.comment: the provider service name (i.e. "aws.us-west-2", "paas.manhattan.corp-gq1")

inputs.name: domain
inputs.comment: the domain of the instance

inputs.name: service
inputs.comment: the service this instance is supposed to run

inputs.name: instanceId
inputs.comment: unique instance id within provider's namespace

inputs.name: info
inputs.comment: the refresh request

inputs.name: provider
inputs.comment: the provider service name (i.e. "aws.us-west-2", "paas.manhattan.corp-gq1")

inputs.name: domain
inputs.comment: the domain of the instance

inputs.name: service
inputs.comment: the service this instance is supposed to run

inputs.name: instanceId
inputs.comment: unique instance id within provider's namespace

resources.comment: called to post multiple zpe related metric attributes

inputs.name: domainName
inputs.comment: name of the domain the metrics pertain to
